name: NPR
text:
A Homeland Security official has filed a whistleblower complaint saying the head of DHS instructed him to stop reporting on the Russian threat to the U.S. election because it "made President Trump look bad."
 https://t.co/jMGgXCFWYC

name: NPR
text:
In February, President Trump acknowledged the severity of the novel coronavirus to journalist Bob Woodward — saying it's "more deadly than even your strenuous flus."

Speaking on Fox News the following month, Trump likened COVID-19 to the seasonal flu.
https://t.co/ppo0sD6rQG

name: NPR
text: Young voters may be poised for a big turnout in 2020. Today on #NPRConsiderThis, how Gen Z — those born in or after 1996 — are thinking about presidential candidates and today's major political parties. https://t.co/GD6RLHBOfZ

name: NPR
text:
Scientists and engineers in California are building a unique 3.2 billion-pixel camera for a telescope under construction in Chile.

The camera has already taken its first test pictures — of some Romanesco broccoli.
https://t.co/7km2Chd1EF
